alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 23 at 1:13PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Colorado... Colorado River near CO-UT State Line affecting Mesa and Grand Counties. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Colorado River near CO-UT State Line. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...at 10.0 ft, minor flooding is expected between Redlands and Loma. Sections of the Riverfront Pedestrian/Bike Trail become inundated with water between Fruita and Loma. Impacts...at 12.00 ft, low-land flooding is likely between the Redlands and Loma, multiple sections of the bike path along the Colorado River may be inundated and become impassable. Water levels approach bridge structures along I-70, between Fruita and Loma. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 12.3 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around bankfull through the weekend with a maximum value of 12.8 feet late Saturday morning. Forecasts indicate water levels decreasing next week, below flood stage. - Action stage is 12.5 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks, and please heed all trail and roadway closures. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
